channel.title: Movies | Indie and Blockbuster Film Reviews

image.title: Movies | Indie and Blockbuster Film Reviews

item.title: ‘The Gallerist’ Review: Natalie Portman Takes Cheap Shots at the Art World in a Schematic, Unfunny Satire
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lattanzio
item.description: Sundance: Cathy Yan's first feature since "Birds of Prey" is an uninspired misfire where the actors, too enamored with the prospect of working together, forget to let the audience in on their chemistry.

item.title: ‘Bedford Park’ Review: Stephanie Ahn’s Cloudy New Jersey Romance Eulogizes an American Dream
item.dc:creator: Alison Foreman
item.description: Sundance: South Korean actors Moon Choi and Son Sukku fall for each other in this hazy feature debut.

item.title: ‘The Shitheads’ Review: Macon Blair Merges ‘The Last Detail’ with ‘Road Trip’ in a Wildly Uneven Comedy That Fails to Find Its Own Lane
item.dc:creator: David Ehrlich
item.description: Sundance: Dave Franco and O’Shea Jackson Jr. are hired to transport an evil rich kid to rehab in a raucous comedy that never lives up to its best moments.

item.title: ‘The Invite’ Review: You’re Going to Want to Attend Olivia Wilde’s Crackling, Crazy Entertaining Dinner Party from Hell
item.dc:creator: Kate Erbland
item.description: Sundance: The director also stars in the film alongside Seth Rogen, Edward Norton, and Penelope Cruz. The foursome are wonderfully unpredictable together in a great comedy with plenty to say about life, love, and nightmare that is marriage.

item.title: ‘Zi’ Review: Kogonada Rediscovers His Voice with a Micro-Budget Hong Kong Experiment Starring Michelle Mao and Haley Lu Richardson
item.dc:creator: David Ehrlich
item.description: Sundance: Smarting from an ill-received foray into studio filmmaking, the "Columbus" director rebounds with a DIY curio about a wayward artist's journey back to herself.

item.title: ‘Barbara Forever’ Review: A Loving and Intimate Tribute to a Queer Cinema Legend
item.dc:creator: David Ehrlich
item.description: Sundance: Brydie O’Connor’s Barbara Hammer documentary is a veritable goldmine of queer cinema history, and a film worthy of its peerless subject.

item.title: ‘Nuisance Bear’ Review: What Happens When a Polar Bear Comes to Town?
item.dc:creator: Kate Erbland
item.description: Sundance: In Jack Weisman and Gabriela Osio Vanden's documentary, the "Polar Bear Capital of the World" takes center stage. So too does a pesky young bear, who becomes emblematic of something much bigger (and harder to chronicle in just one film).

item.title: ‘Fing!’ Review: A Terribly British Tale of a Horrid Little Girl and Her Chaotic Furry Friend
item.dc:creator: Brian Welk
item.description: Young star Iona Bell outshines her adult counterparts in this tall tale of a kids’ movie, full of exaggerated characters and cheeky cynicism.

item.title: ‘The Moment’ Review: Charli XCX Asks If That’s All There Is to a Brat Summer, and in a Mostly Shallow Satirical Flex
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lattanzio
item.description: Sundance: Aidan Zamiri’s mockumentary portrait feels like a face sheet in motion for Charli's +1s, though the singer/star gives a commanding screen performance as, well, herself.

item.title: ‘I Want Your Sex’ Review: Gregg Araki Begs Gen Z to Be Horny and Vulnerable with Each Other in a Fun but Stilted Return to Form
item.dc:creator: David Ehrlich
item.description: Sundance: Cooper Hoffman becomes Olivia Wilde's sex slave in a clear-eyed (if disappointingly) tame satire about sex, truth, and the importance of putting yourself out there.

item.title: ‘Mum, I’m Alien Pregnant’ Review: A Sweet Kiwi Gross-Out Comedy Coated in Extra-Terrestrial Goo
item.dc:creator: David Ehrlich
item.description: A New Zealand woman gets knocked up by something from another world in a movie that has a sweet, sticky heart underneath its juvenile humor and outrageous prosthetics.

item.title: ‘Leviticus’ Review: ‘Heated Rivalry’ Meets ‘It Follows’ in Entertaining Horror Debut
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lattanzio
item.description: Sundance: After an exorcism meant to “cure” their queerness, two suburban Australian boys are stalked by a presence that takes each other’s form.
